Battleship

Class GameHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • Battleship.GameHelper

  • public class GameHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps run the Game Logic. It's primary job is to keep track of the Ships that have been hit.
    Version:
    May 30, 2019
    Author:
    Tanav, Riya, Period: 5, Assignment: Batttleship_APCSFinalProject, Sources:

    • Field Detail

      • shipsArray

        public static Ship[] shipsArray
        A Ship Array that holds the different types of ship instances. This is helpful to iterate through the ships and to check if any of the ship's colors are the ones that have been hit.

      • scoreP

        public int scoreP
        int variable to keep score of the Player's points.

      • scoreC

        public int scoreC
        int variable to keep score of the Computer's points.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameHelper

        public GameHelper()
        Constructor for Game Helper. Initializes the Colors object, initializes the ShipArray[] and sets Player and Computer score to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getScoreC

        public int getScoreC()
        Returns the Computer Score
        Returns:
        Computer Score

      • getScoreP

        public int getScoreP()
        Returns the Player Score
        Returns:
        Player Score

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore(java.awt.Color c,
                        int who)
        This method updates the score for the computer or player. Depending on whether the entered integer corresponded with player or computer, the method called findShipForColor(Color c) and tried to find which ship had just been hit. Depending on which ship had been hit, the method adds points to the player or computer's score.
        Parameters:
        c - The Ship Color which had just been hit
        who - Who the score needs to be updated for. 1 For player, 0 for Computer.

      • createShipsArray

        public Ship[] createShipsArray()
        This method simply initializes the shipArray, and other classes making their own ShipArray[] with different instances of the ships at different indexes.
        Returns:
        instantiated shipArray which contains the different instances of ship

      • hasSunk

        public Ship hasSunk(java.awt.Color c,
                    java.lang.String who)
        This method checks if any ships remain of a specific color on the board. Since all the ships have different colors, it takes in which color has been hit and iterates through the PlayerLocation or ComputerLocation 2D array to find any more occurrences of the color. If there are more occurrences, it returns false, otherwise it returns true.
        Parameters:
        c - The Ship Color that has been just hit
        who - Who needs who needs to check if something has sunk or not, "p" for player and "c" for computer
        Returns:
        The Ship object that has been sunk

      • random

        public static int random(int multiply)
        Since Math.Random() did not provide us with enough randomness, this is a custom random method. It makes a size 100 array and sets all its values to random values with Math.Random(). Then with Math.random, it generates a random index, and multiplies that with the multiplies and returns the value.
        Parameters:
        multiply - the necessary multiple of the randomly generated number to return
        Returns:
        the random number from 0-multiply
